answers.answer: i had gd....it wasnt so bad..once i learned what i could and couldnt eat.  i got my tester free from the diabetes dr.  actually there is this thing that came w/ that had a loaded spring and you just push a button and it snaps it so fast you dont even realize it.  i tested way more than they said to.  i wanted to know what foods affected me what ways.  No sugar, limited fruit (very limited), very tiny servings of bread and pasta (best eaten w/ a protein) and veggies were okay as long as i didnt eat potatoes or corn.  I ate a lot of cheese and yogurt.  Nuts were good and I dont eat meat so i did eat a lot of soy products.  quantity also came into play but if you eat a small snack type meal every few hours you are fine.  No pancakes killed me.  I was able to control it through diet which was great.  good luck.  :)

I was diabetic with my first baby--I use to eat a lot of skinless chicken with cream of broccoli soup for lunch--I would eat yogurt and fruit with grape nuts cereal for breakfast (this one was a little high in carbs) but would fill me up and last along time.  For supper I would have green beans or carrotts with a very sensible meal.  If I wanted pop I would drink diet pepsi caffenine free or diet sprite.   Watch out for things that say sugar free--they can still have lots of carbs in them.  I did cut out tons of things that had carbs--I went very extreme with my diet once I found out--I did only end up gaining 17lbs the whole pg that way--You can eat more complex carbs they actually last longer and break down way slower so they are better for you.  I am a meat eater--so if I wanted McDonalds I would get a double cheeseburger no bun--and eat a side salad.  Peanuts are a great snack--high in protein low in carbs, Now they have great ice cream for carb smart diets that also help with this.
